Description: One irregular fragment of a heavy black, tan and redwoven rug made of goat hair, sheep wool and camel wool. One selvedge edge is present. The weave is warp-faced and all yarns are 2-ply. The stitch gauge is warp 4 per 10mm and weft 14 per 10mm.The warp is made of 'z'-plied yarns most of which were grouped before being plied. The weft is made of various yarn scraps of different types including sheep wool and goat hair. The fragment has a central stripe 118mm wide. Within the central stripe are horizontal rows of dark brown triangles outlined in white. A single red triangle is located in the centre of each row and the rows are separated by white lines. This was bordered on either side by a stripe of undyed medium brown camel wool 0.50m wide which was in turned bordered by a narrower stripe, 16mm wide of goat hair which formed the rug edge. The goat hair band alternates light and dark hair warps to achieve an alternating light and dark horizontal bar patterning.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kulubnarti, 21-S-2 Area southwest of House E-1 Fill
Bibliographic references: Adams & Adams 1998 / Kulubnarti II, The Artifactual Remains (p. 56, 78, 118, pl. 9.3E, F)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 85.2.76 (excavation object cat. no.)
